name: Lange's conjecture
rephrased: A conjecture about the stability conditions for vector bundles on algebraic curves.
implication_form: If [specific condition on vector bundles and curves is met], then [stability holds] (exact statement not provided).
solved_by: Montserrat Teixidor i Bigas and Barbara Russo
explained: Lange's conjecture, proposed by Herbert Lange, pertains to the Brill-Noether theory for vector bundles on algebraic curves. It addresses the existence and properties of stable vector bundles of fixed rank and determinant on a curve of genus g. Specifically, it concerns the Brill-Noether variety parameterizing semistable vector bundles of rank r and fixed determinant with specified invariants, and conjectured that under certain conditions, this variety is non-empty and has the expected dimension. This conjecture was proven by Montserrat Teixidor i Bigas and Barbara Russo in 1999.
related_conjectures: Green's Conjecture (on the syzygies of curves)
The Gieseker-Pulte conjecture (on the birational type of moduli spaces)
The conjecture on the existence of Gieseker-Pulte bundles
The Brill-Noether conjecture for parabolic bundles
